text:
(Three Floyds Moloko) Bottle 650ml from rxeight, thanks Alan! Served into a shaker at home.
Dark brown to black colour on the body, one finger of thick, dark brown head on top, creamy and with very good retention. 
Aroma of light roasted malts, milky chocolate, chocolate milk.
Taste is sweet with chocolate milk, cocoa, sweet chocolate, light roasted malts, well hidden alcohol, toffee.
Medium thick bod, creamy mouthfeel, smooth. Soft carbonation.
A very good milk stout.

Poured from the bottle. Appearance is black and opaque. Tons of viscosity (since that is the adjective of the day for the raters below). Aroma is toasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, with sweetness. Sweet chocolate flavor.

Dark, fairly viscous, smattering of khaki head on the surface. Smells of anise, roasted hop, molasses, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is a roasted vanilla cocoa, anise, roasted marshmallow, lactose. Creamy milky mouthfeel.

Dark, fairly viscous, smattering of khaki head on the surface. Smells of anise, roasted hop, molasses, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is a roasted vanilla cocoa, anise, roasted marshmallow, lactose. Creamy milky mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark, fairly viscous, smattering of khaki head on the surface. Smells of anise, roasted hop, molasses, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is a roasted vanilla cocoa, anise, roasted marshmallow, lactose. Creamy milky mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and dispensed to a snifter displaying a black/brown hue, with a decent layer of brownish tan, fine bubbled froth, and sheet-like lacing that dispersed to show lingering spots & patches. The nose was roasted, but otherwise, somewhat subtle, with hints of smoke & char, mocha notes, and creamy maltiness. The body was medium to full, with some perky effervescence for a Stout, moderate caramel sweetness, low roasted & earthy bitterness, and a pleasant creaminess to the texture. Calmly robust, and well put together.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Type: 12-oz. draft
Glass: Clear snifter class
From: World of Beers in Naperville, Ill.
Price: $8.00
Purchased: Sept. 16, 2016
Consumed: Sept. 16, 2016
Reviewed as: Milk/Sweet Stout
Misc.: N/A

Had this on my want list on Beer Advocate and was excited to get to try it on my first trip to the area. Decided that I was going to have two of the three big boozy beers at WOB (3 Floyds Moloko and Clown Shoes Billionaire), only missing out on Dark Horses Plead the 5th. Had high hopes as Im a big fan of the style.

Poured a pitch black color with 3-to-4 fingers of khaki tan, rocky head. Excellent lacing. Good retention. (Sight - 4.50)

Smelled toffee, roasty malts, caramel, mocha, chocolate milk, vanilla and Mud Slide. (Smell - 4.00)

Tasted roasty malts, mocha, white chocolate, Mud Slide, slight smoky fire, toasted toffee, chocolate milk, a touch of cocoa and roasty nuts. (Taste - 4.00)

Full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, roasty finish. (Feel - 4.25)

Just a very nice milk stout. Would have it again and would like to try the barrel-aged version. (Overall - 4.00)

4.06 91 A-

Very smooth. Lost of roasted malt and hints of chocolate good. mouthfeel stays medium full without being sticky. Tons of flavor but drinkable. Less sweet than a left hand which I really like. Tight carbonation keeps is feeling lighter. Very good. Just enough lactose sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours black. Has a big malty chocolate smell. The palate is full body and wet. The taste is malty sweet. Milky and chocolate. Coffee and roasty nuts.

Dark, toasted malts, chocolate, sweet milk coffee, molasses. Hazy, dark brown, medium, creamy, beige head. Light sweet. Intense cacao, chocolate, praline, dark fruits, dry bitterness in the finish, full bodied, soft carbonation. Beautiful Sweet Stout, excellent chocolate flavours throughout, very well-balanced. Keg at brewery, Munster, IN.

650 ml bottle. Dark brown color with a dark tan head. Sweet espresso malt cherry chocolate aroma. Cherry chocolate sweet milk flavor. Very smooth heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clever name, from one of my favorite movies. Dark black with thick mocha head.  Thanks HankDaStank for helping me get a top 50 in my favorite style: Milk. Medium sweetness at first, then becomes dry. Sweet Stout. If there was a Korova Milk bar that just served sweet stouts, I dont think id leave.
Draft: Poured a black with brown head. Aroma was rich roast malts and chocolate. Taste was sweet chocolate and more of that light roast malt.
Nice brew. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is full of roasted malt with coffee notes. Very smooth with a dry sticky finish.
A delicious beer of chocolate and coffee. Big body, smooth, and a mild sweetness that can be enjoyed at any temperature. Highly drinkable.
Pitch black color, dark brown head. Slight lactic nose with some roasted malt character. Molasses, lactic notes, very smooth low carbonation. Medium body. Very drinkable.

Draught. Dotted spots on the glass. Naked black surface to an almost jet black body. Mid-sweet aromas of dark malts, with liquorice to the fore. Rich taste of liquorice, molasses and mild lactose. Lingering finish with a backdrop of dark fruits. Warming and smooth. Well blended and well crafted. Lovely (Black Sensation at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, Copenhagen 12.11.2015).

Aroma and taste is sweet roasty malty, with chocolate, vanilla hits, quite sweet milky, pretty decent overall.

---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12.11.2015, tap @ Mikkeller Bar Black Sensation:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, dark malts, dark sugar, licorice, grass, caramel, coffee. Taste is slightly dry roasted, dark malts, grass, coffee, weeds, raw licorice, minerals, bark, caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and watery mouthfeel. Nice.
Tasting at Hackneys Printers Row. Jet black pour. Sweet coffee, vanilla, deep roasted malt, creamy sweet palate. Perfectly hopped finish. Excellent.

Black pour with a three finger creamy to soapy mocha head that has great retention. Aroma is big on roast, some coffee, dark chocolate, lots of licorice, light nutty notes and some faint autumn leaves. Flavor is big roast and bittersweet chocolate, dark caramel, light roast coffee, lots of sweetness, but in a way thats well balanced. Heavy, creamy body light, but blanketing ad slightly sharp carbonation. Really damn god stuff.

Bottle from Lville. Poured into a snifter at home. A deep black, oily pour with a mocha head. No lace. Slight reddish hue. Aroma is dark chocolate, milk chocolate, Ovaltine, and slight booze. Taste is big chocolate up front with a booze and lactose finish. Big body, thick. Very delicate and velty on the palete. Sweet and bitter finish. Very good.

Pour to snifter, typical stout appearance. Dark khaki head, opaque body, modest retention. Sweet milky cocoa nose, flavor surprisingly dry and, dare I say, a bit refreshing somehow. Nicely done, but Im gonna have to cork this bomber and save for later. This ones all about the sweet cream, milk chocolate, and clean finish...makes a good dessert.

Bottle. Pours black with a mocha head. Smells of chocolate, lactose, roasted malts, some alcohol apparent after it has warmed. Taste is similar. A slight sweetness up front followed by a light bitterness. Medium+ bodied and creamy; average carbonation. Finishes lightly bitter.
22oz bottle. Oily black pour and dark tan head that quickly diminishes. Aroma is exceptionally rich and chocolatey. Smooth, creamy, and well blended. A delicious stout.
Excellent milk stout. Not one of the stout styles that really is a slam dunk for high ratings, has to be done right and this one is. Smooth and slightly sweet.
22oz bottle. An insanely easy to drink milk stout - pretty perfect in every way. perfect for a chilly fall evening

another trip to the local Fort Wayne rip and run, another Three Floyds Gem.. en joyed in ye olde Hilton Garden Inn of Fort Wayne. Upgraded room and still I expect mores. Pours dark, silky khaki head. solid sweetness, dark chocolate. Mouth feel had lingering dryness. Like impressive, its been at least 10 minutes since past sip and my mouth feels like the Sahara. silky bodhi and I get to sleep in tomorrow late af. chill.

Bomber from Beer Bazaar. Amazed never rated down through the years, as this is a solid go-to stout. Very, very dark brown, almost black, pour with a light brown head leaving some nice streaky lacing early, then fading to nothing late. Aroma has caramel, some lactose, roast and some chocolate. Later down in the glass, cocoa shows through more, with some ash. Taste is of sweet caramel, some milk and some cocoa, but all well offset by the roast and ash presence. Sweet, yes, but fairly well balanced. Even some light smoke detected near the end. 14.8

Black, tan, and nice lacing. Roast, espresso, sweet caramel, roast and chocolate. Full bodied, malt sweet, chocolate, and syrupy notes. Sweet, mild dry notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Roasted malt aroma and milk chocolate, some anise and char too. Slight dark fruits in the smell as well. Taste is initially milk chocolate and black licorice; then big roasted malts, cola, and dark fruits the rest of the way.
Bottle compliments of Indiana_Red: Earthy sweetness with a bit of liquorice - interesting and unique. Paired well with a Arturo Fuente cigar!

BOttle shard by PInkZambia Rich thick black pour tan head. Lots of mild roasted aromas. Rich smooth palatte. Lingering light roasted campfire trailer. The little lactose really smooths itout. Very nice

On tap enjoyed September 2, 2015 in a tulip at Cellarville on Bethel Road.

Look - Thick light tan head. Fine bubbles. Dark brown body. Black almost. Not a lot of lacing. Blotchy at best.

Smell - Hop. Raisin. Bubblegum. Coffee. Chocolate.

Taste - Tootsie roll. Chocolate. Coffee. Vanilla. Char finish.

Feel - Not watery for a milk stout. Fluffy but not too thick. Better as it warms. No bitterness on tongue.

Overall - Good stuff. Next to North High it is my benchmark milk stout. This was my first Floyds and just now rated it.
Bomber picked up by tommy in indiana....thx man....i really liked this beer...light coffee and chocolate...not too much of either.really smooth beer...

Bottle via trade. Poured a medium density pitch black with a foamy smaller dark mocha colored head. Aroma of milk, medium toast, dry bread, light chocolate, dark berry skins. Medium to lighter mouthfeel, fizzy slightly stronger carbonation. Flavor of milk, dark toast, dry burnt malts, ash, light chocolate, touch of cardboard on the backside. Solid beer.

Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aromas of looots of milk chocolate, sweet dark ripe fruits, some toasty notes, vanilla beans, lactic sweet. Taste is as follows, lots of sweet milk chocolate, sweet licorice, dark ripe fruits, vanilla, toasty malts and some sweet-ish coffee.
Bottle. Black beer with almost no head. Malty roasted caramell cocoa aroma. Roasted tar and ashy, caramell, licorice some coffee, toffee flavour.

22 oz bottle shared with ebone1988. The pour is a nice light black with a finger of lighter tan head that falls down to a ring and film. The aroma is a little sweet. There is a lot of roasted malt here. Some lactose pokes through, but I'm getting a lot of roasted malt and brewers licorice with a hint of bitterness. The flavor is really roasty. There is a lot of lactose through the middle of the flavor and it rolls through a light roast on the back end. The mouth feel is pretty good. There is a nice carbonation that helps it stick around a little bit. The aftertaste is lingeringly lactose and a faint roast. Pretty good milk stout for what it's worth

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is sweet, malty, lactose sugar, roasted malt. Appearance is black, light brown head. Taste is lactose, roasted malt, milk chocolate. Mouthfeel is a touch light, sweet finish but great carbonation. Overall, pretty good but I set the bar high.
22oz bottle pours a dark black with A smlall tan head. Smooth cocoa with roasted malt. A very nice milk stout.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a medium size brown foamy head with good retention and some light lacing notes. Aroma of black chocolate and light dry roasted malt with some residual sugar notes. Taste is a good mix between some black chocolate notes, subtle dry roasted malt with quite a bit of lactose being apparent. Body is full enough with good creamy texture and good carbonation. Well brewed for the style with good balance between the different flavors.

How: Draught.
Where: Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Fruit, milk chocolate, some caramel.
Body: Medium to full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, milk chocolate, malt, some coffee, milk, caramel.
Fad: Kulsort øl med et lille skumhoved. Duft af let brændt malt og masser af sødme. Balancen er superlækker og mælkesødmen er fint komplimenteret af en solid gang humle. Lækker øl
Bottle pours like used motor oil with a small tan head and little lacing. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, and toasted malts. Flavor is creamy with mild cocoa bitter. Yum.

Bottle share at Bruces birthday drinks craft beer co. Many thanks to Bruce. Aroma is milky lactose sugar, nutty malts, milk choc, clean. Dark caramel brown coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Flavour is nutty clean malt, milk choc, light berry fruit, dark choc, little tangy beer. Palate is full and milky with moderate carbonation.

Bottle shared during Bruces birthday - many thanks to the birthday man! Pours black-brown with a creamy beige head. The aroma holds smooth chocolate with accents of coffee, dark fruits. Medium sweet flavor, some milk chocolate, subtle earthy bitterness, toasty bread, burnt sugars. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finishes pretty sweet with well toasted malts, more cocoa, light bitterness. Great stuff.

Bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours near black with a thick tan head. The nose is smooth, creamy, roasted malt, milky coffee, cocoa, earth, light spice and toast. The taste is smooth, bitter-sweet, milk chocolate, creamy, toasty, horlicks, earth and charred toast with a dry finish. Med+ body, fine carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Not a whole lot of depth, but great balance and high drinkability for the abv.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
22oz bottle pours a dark black color with some frothy tan head. Smooth cocoa with some mild hoppiness. Very easy going.

Im a huge fan of stouts, milk stouts, imperial stouts, java stouts, etc. This was by far the worst stout that has EVER crossed my lips! People rate this high just because its from 3 floyds. The MOST over rated brewery in the world! Bells double cream stout is a WAY better example of this style.

Bottle, thnx to bytemesis. Pours a very dark, almost black beer with a very small beige head on top. Aroma has loads of coffee, malts, slight dark fruits and a hint of lactose in the back. Flavor is moderately sweet, with caramel and molasses upfront and some coffee with milk in the back. Roasty notes in there all the way, full bodied mouthfeel and well rounded flavors. Aftertaste is long and sweet, low level of carbonation. Good stuff.

Poured from a 22oz bottle from my friend kaiser - thanks!

Aroma - Chocolate and boozy smelling.

Appearance - Pitch black, small head that goes away quickly.

Taste - Considering the boozy aroma, it is a pretty smooth beer. Some lingering burn in the after taste.

Palate - Very fizzy and lively. 

Overall - Good sweet stout - perhaps my first sweet stout, even though it is labeled as a milk stout.

Tasted from draft. Pours black with a beige head. Incredible aroma. Vanilla, coffee, chocolate. Taste is moderately bitter with a nice malt backbone. Lot of chocolate taste with hint of coffee. Vanilla, caramel and a little dark fruits. Excellent sweet stout. Right up there with the best sweet stouts I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

November 22, 2014. On tap at MIkkeller Bar Stockholm. Black with a brown head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, milk chocolate, sweet licorice and coffee. Taste is medium sweet caramel, milk chocolate and vanilla, light smooth bitterness. Finish is sweet and rounded with milk chocolate and coffee. Smooth medium bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation.
Thanks to my Dad for bringing this back from the brewery. Pours darkest brown with red tinge and light tan head. Scent is smoky candy. Sweet to earth flavor. Bottle - Shared by Dad

Pours black with minimal head. Aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Taste is very balanced sweet chocolate and vanilla with light bitter bite in the finish. Lingering milk chocolate sweetness. Light yet creamy body with soft carbonation.

Keg at Mikkeller, Stockholm.  Perfectly black, beige head. Rich coffee aroma. Mid sweet with medium-full body and rounded mouthfeel. Coffee with sugar and milk. Licorice, coffee and tobacco. Low bitterness. Concentrated flavours.
Shared by dedollewaitor, thanks. Dark brown body with a medium light brown head. Coffee, chocolate, fruit, roasted malt. Nice.
Bottle via trade with Hannont. Thanks Todd. 2012. Shared with Hallinghansen. Pours black with a creamy head. Mocha, roast, fruit and chocolate. Medium bodied. Soft. Tasty!

bomber shared. pours a dark brown to almost black with mocha head. aroma is huge sweet dark malts and chocolate and on the end traces of alcohol. the flavor is deep roasted sweet malts lots of sweet chocolate...my this is sweet...but well balanced from start to finish. overall if you dont like a sweet stout this is not for you...but if you do this is top of the line for sweet stouts..

A very nice lasting head. Sweet and bitter at same time. Very chocolate. Aroma is the same. Thick on the tongue. Yet is still prefer left hand. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 141024. Roasted malty with chocolate and coffee, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and bitter with roasted notes and chocolate and coffee/coffee beans.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 24/10-14. Aroma: Coffee, roasted notes. Taste: Dito + chocolate. The finish is dry with coffee, chocolate and roasted flavors.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a long lasting creamy brown head. Aroma is sweet. clearly lactose sugar, a hint of roasted malt and chocolate. Full bodied, very creamy, soft carbonation and a sweet finish.

On tap at North Down, Chicago. Poured a black with a khaki head. Nice aromas of milk chocolate, sweet Malts and coffee. Very creamy mouthfeel. Taste is sweet milk chocolate with espresso and vanilla. Very smooth. Really easy drinking. I liked this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black pour, beige head with light sticky lacing .... Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted and caramel malts and some lactose sugar ... Taste is of dark chocolate, coffee, light smoke, caramel and roasted malts and some lactose sugars ... Had a dry malty and dark chocolate ...... Finishes with a light bitterness ..... Solid milk stout

this was a beer that grew on me. at first the body seemed a little thin (at least for what i was hoping) from a milk stout, but as it breathed, it was increasingly creamy and smooth. aroma is highly roasted, almost like a dry irish, but the feel and flavor have a definite lactic quality. milk chocolate galore and a touch of hops. well dome."

Location: Bottle sent by Andy, 9/27/14


Aroma: The nose of this beer is rich chocolate malts with some other roasty notes as well

Appearance: This one pours a dark brown color with a smallish brown head on top

Flavor: The flavor is almost chocolate milk shake like, noticeable lactose, pretty sweet and rich

Palate: The body is medium, fairly creamy and smooth, with a soft carbonation to it

Overall Impression: 
Andy, you are the man for sending us beer even though you couldnt make it down! This is a nice milk stout. Theres nothing not to enjoy here.

Bottle thanks to trade with jdb288! Pours a thick black with thin brown ring of head that leaves light lace. Aroma is roast and chocolate back end of soy and lactose. Taste is more toward the lactose and the chocolate, thick and viscous, slight warming on the way down. Very nice milk stout, would love to try the barrel versions.
This is damn good. Near black pour with tan head. Aroma is chocolate and vanilla. Taste adds a sweetness. Very creamy. Enjoyable.

Bottle from unknown via Kyler B. Pours a rich dark brown/black, decent amount of tan head. Lactose sugar, roasted notes, oats in aroma. Some chocolate. Body mildly roasty, oat and lactose in finish. Nice but not deserving of the ratings.

濃いースタウ  
ちょっと苦く&

22 oz. bottle from Crown Liquors in downtown Indianapolis, IN. Pours, somewhat, thick, black, with an ashy brown head that dissipates somewhat quickly. Some loose head sits on top. This looks promising. A little bit of half and half, coffee, and chocolate.Its rather straight-forward on the aroma. Nothing spectacular. Lactose, chocolate, half and half, and a little roast pop through. Theres a tiny, tiny bit of coffee in there, too. Theres some depth to this, but not too terribly much. It has a nice texture to it, but its not the greatest sweet stout that I have had; albeit, it is pretty damn sweet. Glad to have tried, but theres no need to seek this out again.

Dark brown/black with a chocolate head. Aroma is chocolate, oatmeal, roasted grain, Brazil nuts. Medium-full bodied, very creamy mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a nutty and lightly roasty finish. Taste is milk chocolate, almond meal, oatmeal, dates, caramel.

Drank 8-31-14
Found this at bourbon barrel terre haute in. his is my first three floyds beer. Drank on the first night we moved to friona texas for a new job. Pours a dark black with a creamy head. aromas of caramel, whiskey barrel light, and nutty. Flavors of caramel, medium smoke, medium caramel. medium sweetness. Light smoky aftertaste. THis is a well done well rounded milk stout. THe sweet and smokyness get slighty cloying after a while.

taster on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Nice aroma of bitter chocolate and malt. Opaque black color, good heavy brown head cover, dots of lace. Taste is malt and rich milk chocolate that moves aggressively through the palate. Then it adds chocolate syrup and mild hops in a lingering sweet and bitter finish. A unique and well-conceived, balanced sweet stout.

Bottle. Black pour with a nice tan head. Dark chocolate and a little molasses on the schnoz. Chocolate and a tid bit of coffee on the taste with light smokiness and is pretty sweet. Great brew the dark roasted malts keep this sweet beast from getting too sweet.

Bottle pour. Deep, dark brown in color with a thin tan head. Great waft of bakers chocolate and a slight hint of coffee. The mouthfeel is creamy, smooth, flaked oats. Big roasted malts amp up the profile. As close to a chocolate milkshake as you can get here. There is a bitterness that ensures that this stout does not go into the deep end on the sweetness scale.

Rating #2600. Bomber from Savor Growl. Deep blackish pour with a frothy brown head. Aroma of burnt coffee, chocolate, lactic. Tastes are milk chocolate, roasty, molasses, dark fruit, sweet milky. Slight background smokiness. Creamy thin to medium palate. Very drinkable. As good as any sweet stout Ive tried.

Look: pours a dark brown. Light brown head like brown sugar. Thick oily lacing.
Smell: chocolate. Coffee, maybe espresso. 
Taste: coffee. Chocolate. Slight smokiness. Very sweet. Chocolate milk.
Feel: thick mouth feel. Slightly oily. 
Overall: good beer. Like the sweet and the chocolate. Coffee flavors even work well, though I don't like coffee. 
First drank: home 8/18/14

Pours pitch black with a khaki head. Aroma of roasted malt and milky lactose sugar. Taste is smoky and sweet. Great balance of flavor and overall excellent beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black like oil with tan head. Cocoa, roasted malt, caramel and a bit of nuts on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes sweet and dry.
Bottle. No head. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, lactose sugar, little licorice and has a nice dry finish.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours black with a fading brown head. Aroma of roast malt, sweet chocolate, caramel, coconuts, little dried fruit. Flavor is malty, caramel, dark chocolate, berries, dark fruit. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. 110614
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and a little cocoa. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110614

Bottle. Pours black with a diminishing creamy tan small head. Aroma is mild and sweet with candy, dark fruit, lactose, roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Body is medium+, texture is mild creamy/sticky, carbonation soft. Finishes sweet and dark bready. Rather simple and mild. Definitely wasnt a kick in the yarbles or good for laughs and lashings of the old ultraviolent.

Bottle at droog pentaz while watching A Clockwork Orange. Not in your face, but kind of mellow with notes of chocolate, black berries, minty, light chalky, grain, caramel. Black with a medium sized diminishing tan head. Medium body, oily/light creamy texture, soft carbonation. Medium sweet with light bitterness and warming alcohol. Very soft on the palate and pleasant to drink, but nothing mindblowing.


Spiced it up with a bit of Amager POP! Stange experience.
Black pour, tan head. Nose is chocolate, vegetables, roasted malts. Taste is sweet chocolates, roasted malts, a touch vegetal in the taste too. Mouthfeel is medium and creamy.

22 oz bottle - great silky mouthfeel , notes of mild coffee , cream and vanilla . Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Relatively black, with a lovely, fine bubbled, velvety layer of cream that lasts stupendously long on top. Aroma lends notes of woodsy roast, chocolate, burnt grains, underlying cream, & a mild residual sweetness mostly reminiscent of caramelized brown sugar. Taste has a nice creamy sweetness up front, leading into bittersweet chocolate, roasted malt, toasty brown sugar, & burnt caramel. Roast in the finish with a very faint undercurrent of milky sweetness. Nice, thick, creamy mouth feel... Enjoyed this one even more than I thought I would! Very nice milk stout.

Got a bottle from a trade. Pours heavy into a dark black with a thick thick creamy cocoa color head. Aroma isnt very strong. A milky sweet smell. A sugary sweet sip that is just on the verge of being too sweet. Taste like the milk left over in a chocolatey cereal. In a great way. Sweet stuff but they make it work. Would not mind at all getting some more of this. Also probably my favorite label by the brewery.

2013/09 650ml bomber courtesy of readbaron (CHI), thanks! Pours a relatively thin deep brown with beige crema pillow. Fragant from a distance: dark roast, an acidic prickle (lactic acid developing over 6months in the bottle?) and (oddly) quite a rich load of bourbon chip and vanilla notes (label does not mention any wood aging). Suave and mid-creamy mouthfeel, well-rounded due to the oats. None to sweet, very well-balanced between dark chocolate, crema and light coffee notes with a very disctinct woody acidity projected onto the palate with a lively prickle. Excellent, taste-developed, not too heavy dessert treat for a walnut ice beer float.
Had this at a great neighborhood tasting. Thanks to everyone for sharing! Had so much fun!

Poured from a bomber purchased at 3F into a 3F pint glass a deep dark brown with a massive tan head.
Aroma is coffee chocolate molasses ever so slight smoke.
Flavor is incredible. Sweet cocoa silky smooth. Subtle coffee even more subtle smoke which creates an incredible balance of flavor. 
Overall this brew is smooth & luscious sweet milk stout. Pretty much the best milk stout I have ever tasted.

Poured from a 2013 ( about 1 year old) bomber into Three Floyd glass. Aroma is sweet dark chocolate. Appearance is a dark brown almost black allowing virtually no light to pass. Pours a nice frothy 2 finger tan head that dissipates slowly. Taste is an incredible semi sweet dark chocolate with a slight smoke finish. Palate is almost milkshake like going down very smooth. A definite recommend for everyone tp try.
pretty good, though i suspect this bottle was a little past its prime when we opened it.
Solidly above average. Creamy sweet milk stout. Not too rich. Notes of cocoa.

Milk Milk Milk. Specifically, Milk, chocolate, caramel. My notes says I was eating with some Buffalo wings. Makes sense. Have not had many milk stouts/sweet stouts, so I don;t have much to compare to.

Bottle from a trade poured into a Belgian snifter. Pours black with some brown hues with half a finger of tan head. Aromas of roast, chocolate, lactose, toastiness, caramel, biscuit. Tasting notes of dark and milk chocolates, light roast, caramel, lactose, light toastiness, nutty. Medium body with a semi-dry finish, creamy mouthfeel. One of the better milk stouts that Ive had so far. Pairs nicely with some 5 year gouda.
Drank with Thijs 9-2-2014. Good look. Dark, white yellow foam. Roasty Milk smell. Good taste. Alcohol. Just good, not great. Roasty, milky, alcohol.

Pour is dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is of roast, chocolate, smoke, and light coffee. Flavor is of cappuccino, cocoa, vanilla, and roast. Soft carbonation with a sweet finish. Alcohol is hidden very well.
bottle. great stout, black pour, medium body. very balanced, chcolate, medium roasted maltiness. medium creamy mouthfeel. very nice

22oz bomber poured into a stemmed snifter. A combination of vanilla extract, milk chocolate, and cookie dough bring to mind chocolate chip cookies on the nose. Sweet and drying at the same time, very fun and satisfying brew.

draft - pours dark brown with dark tan head - looked like espresso coffee from above.  Nose is roasted (almost burnt) coffee.  Flavor is dark chocolate and all around malty.  Sweet with expected dark chocolate bitterness.  A good to great stout.  Nice woody aftertaste.

Acquired this in a trade after Dark Lord Day this year. Enjoyed in a snifter at 60 degrees F.

A - I actually started pouring this one vigorously. that was a mistake. Had to do an insanely slow side pour and still the head was about 6 fingers and rising. Sort of a creamy light cocoa head. Black as night beer. The head faded albeit very slowly. 

S - Very roasty and sweet on the nose. Hints of chocolate. 

T - Hint of coffee and nutella. Some darker fruits like figs and hazelnuts as well. Finish is creamy and more espresso beans.

M - High carbonation, medium body.

O - This is pretty dang drinkable. Im not a fan of milk stouts but I really like this one.
Black with a big brown head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts and chocolate,medium body, average carbonation, good

Pours a completly black with a thick frothy tan tan head.  Aromas of roasted malt and dark cocoa.  You get a lot of sweetness right from the beginning that turns to chocolate.  This nice dark chocolate taste lsts through the finish that slowly fades out to a bit of coffee.  This is a really good strong stout.  Easier to drink than an imperial but not any less flavor filled.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2013 22oz bottles, shared with friends. Black color (not opaque). Good brown head. Good dots of lace. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Drier texture, good medium more chewy body. Light milk chocolate. Some roast. Light earthy hops. Bittersweet taste, but leans a bit too much on the cloying sweet side for me. Maybe the lactose is a bit much. Some vanilla. Caramel, hint of burned malts. Friends seemed to like it a lot (one hophead even said "I think Im starting to get turned on to stouts"). Its good for what it is. 6/4/6/4/12 Re-rate, 9/8/13: On tap. A lot less intensely sweet than how I remember the bottle tasting, way better, more balanced, and more complex on tap, for me. Moderate sweet still, but light bitter too, and not cloying. Nice coffee notes in the flavor, much more than I remember, along with some good chocolate. Good chewy texture, smooth creamy lighter carbonation, bigger body. Solid sweet stout, on tap. Tastes much improved.
Bottle from my boy Stfun. Dark brown/black pour with thin tan head. Aroma is rye bread with a hint of chocolate. Taste is a touch of roast with a lactic sugary finish.

This was a solid beer, and quite alcoholic for a milk stout, although to be honest I was expecting something a little more exceptional from 3 Floyds. Pours a very dark brown. Very strong roasted malts, coffee, sweet chocolate, plenty of lactose.
Aroma is dark chocolate, earth and mild sweetness.  The flavor is fruit, milk sweetness, an undercurrent of chocolate and a sour/tart finish.
Bread, chocolate, coffee, alcohol are the flavors that I am experiencing. lactose makes this sweet.

Black. small head. Nose is light coffee, chocolate, sweet sugary burnt malt notes and some flowery hop notes in there. Flavor is rich breads, sticky burnt caramel sugars, coffee and chocolate. Hop flavor is light and present. Sweetness is that of other beers that have not had lactose added so it isnt overly sweet. better than I remember. barrel aged versions are not superior.
Pours an inky black with a tan head. Aromas of milk chocolate, some roast. Pretty tasty. Hints of nesquick, some light roast. Pretty chewy and creamy. Cummy. Nice.
Great milk stout.  Pours black coffee with thick brown head.  Intricate lacing.  Taste chocolate, coffee and raisons.  Very smooth finish with a slight alcohol burn in the back of the throat.

Pours solid rich black-brown with medium sized light brown head. Aroma is wonderful, everything I want in a sweet stout: chocolate, coffee, hazelnut, malt. Taste is very sweet, almost too much (but I guess thats to be expected with a milk stout). Palate is full and thick, almost syrupy. Finish is very mild, with a slight bitterness. Overall a great sweet stout.

Uploading from Beer Buddy App. Notes from memory. Delicious milk stout. Rich and delicate palate like all 3 Floyds brews. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a black with an average sized brown head that lingers.  Aroma is both potent and anticipating.  It contains lots of coffee, chocolate, and vanilla.  Quite roasty.  This tastes very sweet.  The impressions from the aroma are still present here, but this time the chocolate is dominant.  Aftertaste is sweet chocolate.  Smooth and creamy upon drinking with some subtle carbonation.  This is good and I can appreciate its quality.  But it is almost to sweet for me, which prevents me from ranking this higher.

Pours a pure black color with about a finger of a mocha color head. It dissipates to a nice lacing quickly. Smells of lots of roasted malts, carmel, milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oats, some sweetness. Smooth smell with little bitterness on the nose. Taste starts with the roasted chocolate and coffee. Very roasty and a little bitterness up front and then in the middle you get the smooth vanilla, milk chocolate, and coffee. Finishes very smooth with a nice creamy vanilla mocha taste. No alcohol detected at all. Medium body with perfect carbonation. A creamy, smooth mouthfeel. Just a great beer. My favorite milk stout.

Pours black with a slight tan head.  Smells of milk chocolate and malt.  Taste is sweet chocolate, some coffee and a bit of toffee.  This is a very good sweet stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cola-like black with a huge dark head.
Scent is light..cream, chocolate.
Taste is much, much, more of the same....plus vanilla.
Incredibly rich sweetness.....yet not cloyingly-so......just right.
Its an ice cream with a head.
You could heat this up and pass it around a campfire and Im not sure people would know they were drinking a beer.
Throw a couple of mini-marshmallows in and start the sing-a-long.....
Really, really nice.
Thick dark brown head. Prunes raisins toasted malt. Chocolate and roasted flavor with a hop smooth and milky aftertase. Very clean finish.

Great label art!  I thought this might have been made for performing ultraviolence on some lovely young devotchkas with horrorshow groodies, but instead, its just a very good milk stout.  Bomber pours an opaque dark brown - almost black - with a small mocha head and good lacing.  Not much to smell, but aroma has lots of cream, chocolate, and roasted malts, and perhaps a bit of coffee.  Medium body without much carbonation.  Mouthfeel is creamy, and taste is slightly sweet.  Clean finish without much hops.  This one is very well balanced and easy to drink, if not as outrageous as I had expected.

Bottle from trade with StFun. Black pour, with a thick tan head and lots of lacing. Great looking beer. Smell is of sweet malt, with a bit of roasted character, but light on the roasted component. Taste is sweet malt with a balance of roasted malt, but the sweet character of this beer leads the way. Its not over done, fortunately, but that component does stand out. Full mouthfeel, but not thick or syrupy at all. Relatively little in the way of hop presence here. Finishes with the tastes lingering. A nice stout.

On tap at FFF. Pours black with a tan head and nice lacing. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, and sweet cream. Taste is coffee, cocoa, cream, sugar, and roasted malts. Thin mouthfeel and easy to drink. Awesome.

Pitch black pour with inch high brown head. Lots of brown lacing on the way down the glass. Chocolate, milk chocolate scent that is pretty faint. Faint cola smell as well. Thick mouth feel, a little chalky. Very balanced flavor, malty but not overly so, adequately chocolate too. Finish is slightly bitter and burnt but not too smokey. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle looks really interesting. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Starts mild, fine malty, modest roasty. A bit sweet. More and more dry, hints of coffee. Well balanced finish, mild-malty aftertaste. Quite drinkable. A good beer!
A fantastic milk stout all around, though lacking a strong nose.  Jet black with a creamy mocha head -  full bodied, soft carbonation - coffee!, dark chocolate and vanilla sweetness.

On tap at brewery. This is the best milk stout I've ever had. So perfectly balanced. Love it--sweet, malty, chocolately. Yum!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice stout. Pours big black with huge tan head and lace. Aromas of grain, chocolate, cream and piney hops. Big sweet body, but so creamy through the finish.

Pours a thick black. Aroma of chocolate, caramel. Taste follows, milky and smooth. Really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank with Pat before an Eagles game 2 years ago. We also shared this with some crazy nuts at the tailgate. Thanks for the game meat burgers dudes. Pours a dark black color with thick cream colored head and lacing. Aromas of milk chocolate, grass, burnt sugar, roasty malts, and espresso. Taste is very similiar witha buttery lactic body that accentuated the roast and milk cocoa. Awesome beer and artwork. Another gem from 3F.
Bottle to snifter. Looks good for a standard milk stout; low carbonation and thin lacing. Smells good; sweet and malty. Tastes solid; chocolatey. Mouthfeel is good too. Good stuff.

Vintage unknown...but I assume its a Summer 2012 batch. 22 oz bomber into a tulip glass.

A - Pitch black body with a nice three finger high light mocha head. This settles down to some thin edging. Moderate lacing and retention.

S - Roasted malts, milk chocolate, and vanilla. A hint of citrus hops and some lactic acid. Simple, yet smooth and inviting. 

T - Roasted malts and very smooth vanilla. Decadently sweet milk chocolate with a nice roasty finish. Slightly bitter on the end. Mouth feel is light to medium and highly carbonated.

O - This beer has a flavor that is very unique to Three Floyds, which I also found (to a small degree) in Darklord. Very tasty milk stout.

A: impressively black, with a beige head that fades pretty quickly, leaving little trace.

S: lactose, roasted malt, subtle coffee, chocolate

T: a simple and delicious blend of everything I mentioned in the aroma. There is no sign of alcohol. The milk aspect is right on and compliments the roasted malt very well. This is the chocolate milk of beers.

M: extremely smooth and creamy. This makes it remarkably drinkable. I would be interested to have this beer a little crisper, with perhaps slightly more carbonation. The body is thin, but not overly so.

D: Keep em coming. I have had this beer many times, and Im still pleasantly surprised at how tasty it is. This beer is dangerously slammable.

2010 bottle.  Pours dark and black, thick, with a small tan head.  Nose is slightly metallic, from aging Im sure.  Still a good amount of grass and pine with some big chocolate and toffee.  Taste is very sweet and only strts to bitter toward the end but only slightly, sweet continues to dominate in the aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is soft and smooth, creamy.  Heavy body and a long finish.  Even after a couple years its a great beer.

Bottle. Pours very dark. The aroma is rich with malt, oak,  and sweet caramel, very nice aroma. The taste is full of malt and you get a lot of the sweetness of it being a milk stout. Overall a very solid stout, as most of the beers from 3F's. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Auction winner. I liked everything about this stout. It was a bit mild on every ingredient, but it was a milk stout and not an imperial. A good blend of mild, roast, vanilla, cream, milk, coffee that finished sweet and easy. Nice job.

Bottle shared at Mikkeller Bar.  Pours black with a medium tan head.  Aroma is chocolate, lactic and roasted.  Flavour is milky chocolate,  nuts, roasted.  Medium bodied and smooth.  An excellent milk stout.  FFF have done it again with another great beer!
Ok it didnt really matter if it was good beer or not.  Best label design / reference ever.  Also...the beer is great.  You can lick the sweetness off your gums.  Finally a FFF that isnt all hops.
bottle. pours light black medium body. nice pillowy head. aroma of roasted malt and sweet sugar. taste is also roasty and sweet.

Originally reviewed: 11/18/10. 22oz bottle poured into a tall tulip glass. I love the look of this bottle. Gotta be one of my favorites from FFF. This beer pours a super thick and creamy dark black with a finger-width mocha head on top. Disappears rather quickly, but the ring on the edge leaves lots of sticky lace. The nose is full of notes of milk chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, and faint espresso.

Rich creamy mouthfeel. Palate-coating. Subtle carbonation. Fantastic balance with the sweetness coming through with hints of vanilla, sweet milk chocolate, and finishes with a great nutty aftertaste. This is an absolute gulper. The alcohol, though well-hidden in the flavor reveals itself after a few gulps. Be careful: this drinks like a tall glass of chocolate milk. I loved it.

Bottle. Happy 38th Nick. Black pour with a small, dense tan head. Head sticks around and leaves little legs down the glass. Nose is very chocolate orientated with vanilla and milk. Taste again is big on chocolate. Not overly sweet which is pleasing. A good combo of milk chocolate, molasses, a touch of ash, and vanilla. Full mouth feel with soft carbonation. Very good beer

22 ounce bottle.  Pours almost black with a small tan head.  Aroma of dark chocolate, malt, and molasses.  Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, molasses, dark fruit, and coffee.  Sweet, complex, and delicious.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown and tan head. The aroma is milk chocolate vanilla and light roast. Thin mouthfeel with roast and chocolate. Easy to drink with a nice sweet finish. A very good sweet stout from Three Floyds.
Pretty decent. A whole lotta milk chocolate going on. Sweet and creamy. Id drink it again

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 Bottle with Steve and the Foco BA crew. Dark brown appearance with a brown head. Milky, chocolate malty, light coconut, a bit roasty aroma. A bit sweet milky chocolate, a touch fruity, ever so slightly smoky flavor thats well carbonated.

From notes.  First reviewed 12/23/2010.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip.

Moloko has a mahogany walnut color with tints of sienna at the edge of the glass. A small tan head rests precariously on top of the beer, winding down to a thin ring. A little bit of lace forms and disappears with the swirl of the my glass.

The aroma is full of milk chocolate, roasted barley, a little bit of espresso, and a touch of booze. Overall the aroma is a little bit on the light side.

Roasted malt and espresso start strong and transition to a milk chocolate flavor. This is actually somewhat mellow, with more focus on the milk aspect and not a ton of hops blowing me away. A little alcohol bites me in the middle. Pine and just a touch of grapefruit hops just before the finish turns sweet again.

Creamy, with tight, medium carbonation. Lightly sticky and a lighter body than I would have guessed.

Overall pretty well-rounded, but it is lacking anything that really puts it over the top.

2010 bottle from Binnys. Gorgeous pour, opaque with brown head. No hops evident anywhere. Aroma is sweet and lactic (no surprise), complex and even a bit fruity. Bottle was poorly stored, but even so its very nice in flavour. Sweet and rich, thick and full-bodied with a lovely creamy texture. Sweet all the way through, almost no hint of bitterness in the milky finish. Beautiful milk stout.

2010 bomber shared with toffsbury.  Pours opaque and black with a nice brown head.  Smells amazing; sweet milk chocolate and vanilla.  Smooth, thick, sweet, vanilla, roasty, creme brulee mouthful.  Three Floyds youve done it again!

22 oz bottle. Black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Flavor is rich sweet chocolate with some bitter roasted malt and light boozy warming. Full body with mild carbonation and a thick, lush mouth feel. Really nice milk stout, the only bad thing I could say is its pretty sweet.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2012 Great aroma.  Great look.  Tastes thinner than I thought it would.  Milk chocolate in aroma and taste.

Bought at Woodmans in Madison, WI. Super dark pour with a light tan head with tons of lacing. Smell of coffee, chocolate, a tad bit of vanilla. Flavor is chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malts. Really nice and creamy stout. Three Floyds continues to impress.

Bottle. Pours semi-opaque black; pale tan head, weak alcing. Nose is lactic, with creamy roast, some "Coffee Crisp" notes really coming through here... its been years since Ive had a Coffee Crisp, I really should have one again. Further nosing reveals caramel, vanilla, toast, black licorice, and hazel nut, along with a chalky/floral/powdered milk aroma that I only get from Sweet Stouts, and this one has it in spades! Flavours of smoke, ash, nuts, cream, toast... very flavourful, and I really appreciate how dry this is! Finish is oatmeal, with cream of wheat and syrup. A really quite amazing Sweet Stout!

UPDATED: APR 3, 2012 From the 1/2012 3R6P tasting. I was really looking forward to this one, but sadly it really disappointed me - which has been a trend for this brewery of late. +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a black color with a small tan head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was toasty vanilla, licorice and sour lactic acid with a touch of wood underneath. The flavor was semi-sweet and very roasty with notes of vanilla, chocolate and lactic acid. The finish was long and lactic. Smooth and fairly full bodied. Disappinting.

Poured from a bomber into a snifter. Appearance is black with a grey head of foam that lingers for a little while and then to a thin ring around the glass. Aroma is chocolates, caramel, nuts, and a light lactic presence. Taste is loaded with milk chocolate and nuts, while the lactic note picked up in the nose plays a role more mid sip to the finish. Sweet milk stout, but not overly sweet.

Dry and sweet stout...Pours dark, thin, very think for a stout, and quite drinkable.  A lot of roastyness with a dry lingering finish.  Alcohol content is surprisingly low for 3 Floyds but its got a ton of flavor.  Note...this one is about a year old when I drank so less hops and smoother than fresh Im sure.  I dont have a fresh to compare it to, but it was very good.

Location/Date:Bottle split with December 25th, 2011.
Appearance:Pours a dark black.
Aroma:Smells of coffee and milk.
Taste:Light bitterness, light coffee, some milk.
Palate:Medium body, smooth.
Summary: A really tasty milk stout.

Bottle. Pour is black with a massive tan head, good retention/lacing. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roast, vanilla. Taste is sweet, chocolate/coffee, light roast, vanilla, cream. Palate is soft, creamy, full body, creamy finish. Excellent.
Bottle from an awesome trader! Pours black with tan head. Nose/taste of lactose, black licorice, roast chocolate malt and vanilla. Well balanced. Medium body. Great movie reference! (obviously)

Pours a dark brown with a nice foamy 2 finger head. Smells of roasted malt with some coco notes. Has some Mocha and vanilla sweetness. Taste is GREAT!! Has big Coco, coffee, sweetness and nice lactose sugars. Overall a fantastic milk stout!!
bomber shared by jeff with joe and I. thick black with a tan head. huge big thick malty black sweet stout. this is what sweet stouts should taste like.

On tap at Three Floyds, pours a very dark brown with a tan head and nice lacing in the glass, the aroma is of heavy chocolate with a hint of vanilla as well, the flavor has a nice roasty front end with a good amount of chocolate in the finish, very nice mouthfeel, I really enjoyed this.

Thanks to Exiled for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a black color with a tan head. The aroma is full of roasted malt and milk chocolate, exactly as I expected and very enjoyable. 

The flavor is more of the same. There is a lot of chocolate, which is the dominant flavor. There is also some roasted malt and a little sweetness from the lactose. 

Thick mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown almost black with a small darker tan head that fades. caramel, chocolate, mocha,vanilla, light sweetness, lightly bitter, sticky. Not bad beer kind of reminds me of a porter. Semi sweet with a mocha finish. Not the best beer had many that taste like this before just not sure what one they are.

Pours an opaque dark brown with a light brownish tan head.  Aroma is chocolate milk, coffee, roasted malts, and vanilla.  Taste is bitter coffee/roasted malts up front, then a hint of chocolate before a sweet and creamy finish.  The lactose really does its job in this beer.  Very tasty stout with an excellent mouthfeel.

Ive got this text message on my phone telling me to rate this as a 5! All I remember is how much we were praising this brew. It was amazing, if you ever wonder how a milk stout should taste, its would be a Moloko! First 3 floyds ever and I was Blown the F away

Pours an almost opaque black with the darkest of mahogany-ruby fringes. A tan ring of bubbles succumbs to nothing, including the lace left down the glass. Mocha aromas dominate here. A nice smoked bitter coffee malt on the tongue. This sweetness is enforced by lactose sugars, and lends to a nice creamy, milky mouthfeel. A lightly smoked cherry bitter finishes the pull well, and balances the brew superbly.  This is a nice sweet stout.

Bottle. The pour was a muddy dark brown almost black in color with a very large (on the heavy side of 3 fingers) creamy medium brown head that lasted throughout and produced some really excellent lacing.

The aroma was wonderfully heavy of some burnt dark malts and a strong leathery yeast with notes of dark chocolate, dark roasted coffee, molasses and a hint of dark fruit.

The taste was moderately sweet with a hint of dark chocolate and molasses at first then it became extremely malty and moderately bitter with a nice creamy coffee finish. The flavor lasted a very long time after the swallow letting one relish the bitter chocolate coffee flavor.

Mouthfeel was robustly full in body and smooth and creamy in texture with a nice soft carbonation.

Overall an exquisite Stout with the flavors contributing to each in such a way as to produce a truly delightful drinking experience.

Black with thick foamy tan head.  Nose of roasty chocolate milk with a touch of nuttiness, and some coffee.  Mocha milk shake taste.  Really, that says it all.  Creamy chocolate, coffee, vanilla....medium body with perfect carbonation.  Slightly sweet, sticky body.  Perfectly balanced.  Not a monster, not an epic beer, but excellent in everything it sets out to do.

Un breuvage brutalement lacté, aussi peu complexe que facile à boire. Même ma fausse moustache ne ma pas empêché dengloutir ce nectar proprement. Lait de mélasse douce avec finale chocolatée sans aucune trace dalcool.

pours black with a thin off white head an some spotty lacing.  aroma is sweet with note of chocolate and raspberry.  body is syrupy with low carbonation.  taste is rich and sweet but well balanced.  finish is sweet with sugar remaining on the lips.  This is a lovely, sweet and complex beer.
UPDATED: NOV 6, 2011 Very sweet, creamy. Burnt sugar flavor, almost like a creme brulee. Dark beer, but lots of white head. This is very sticky, thick, and damn good.

Im usually a hop head but, I enjoy a great Porter or Stout. This is one of the best. A wonderful chocolate head with that sweetness from the milk lactose. Sweet malty finish. This is what a stout is supposed to be in my book. I could drink this all night!

Sampled at an esbls tasting.  By Shep.   Very dark and stout looking.  A medium sized tan head.  The nose is lactose and is faint.  There is a bit of chocolate with the milk but this is muted.  Some fruity hops come late.

Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is huge milk chocolate, caramel, dark sweet fruits, toasted malts, vanilla and some lacto sweetness. Flavor is also huge milk chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, gentle coffee and some lacto sweetness. Smooth.

Pours jet black with big mocha head.  Decent retention but no lacing.  Caramel, chocolate, a little ash in the nose.  Tons of sweet vanilla and milk chocolate with a bitter coffee finish.  Perfect carbonation, decently full bodied.    Definitely one of the best sweet stouts Ive had.  Very drinkable with very little alcohol presence.

Pours black with a medium mocha head...great lacing and retention.  Aroma has coffee, chocolate, and a hint of dark fruit.  Flavor is definitely sweet but not overly so...roasty chocolate, milky, faint dark fruit, subtle coffee.  Mouthfeel is creamy and the finish is roasty and chocolatey...mmmmm.

GABF 2011.  Pours out oily black, no head. Has an aroma of milk lactose and dark black chocolate with some smooth oats. Flavor is big and rich but not cloying. Heavy dark chocolate, milk lactose, smooth malty sweetness and delightful mouthfeel. Oats not too noticeable unless youre thinking about it.

Tasted on 10/13/11 from a 650mL bomber bottle purchased at Lush West Town some time in early to mid 2010.  Pours nearly black dark brown with a thin tan head that leaves a spot of whispy lace, and a decent collar.  The nose is full of milk chocolate, chocolate milk, molasses, a hint of coconut, and sweet, creamy vanilla.  The flavor is sweet with all of the above flavors, with the molasses, along with cola, dried date, raisin, and prune showing nicely.  The body is full and creamy, with average carbonation, and a long cola, molasses, milk chocolate, and sweet vanilla finish.  After about a minute, a savory roasted flavor kicks in, very interesting, but pleasant.

I poured the last bottle from 2009 into a DFH pint glass. It poured a slightly viscous black tar in color and had a one inch dark khaki head. It looked great. The smell was almost chocolatey sweet and had a good roasted maltiness to it. It even had a little oakyness to it. It drank a little dry and had a good balance of roastiness and sweetness. A very slight amount of alcohol is present in the aftertaste. The mouthfeel is superb. Its medium bodied and coats the mouth, exceptionally creamy and smooth. I loved this one. If not for the cost Id drink it all the time. Its a top notch milk stout.

Finally got to try this on draft at PP Carlsbad.  Very dark brown, almost black, with a small tan head.  Sweet malts, chocolate, definite milk-iness, kinda sweet milk chocolate, light roast, and some booze.  A decent sweet, strong stout.  Glad to try.

On tap @ Pizza Port Carlsbad (nice!).  Black in the glass with a slight, tan head.  Subtle aroma of slight roast and sweet lactic milk sugar.  Clean feel in the mouth.  Taste is light chocolate roast up front, bitterness, sweet milk, and some lingering dark fruit notes in the back third.  Tasty beer.

Thanks to whoever shared this at the Rapture release. Pours out black with a nice white head. Aroma is of chocolate, light coffee, slight roast and some lingering sweetness. Taste is smooth with a nice creamy mouthfeel, roast, light coffee, some chocolate. Pretty tasty stuff.

(22 oz. bottle via trade with pantanap, thanks Kan!) Pours very dark brown with four big fingers of tan head that recede to about half a finger. Big rich aroma of coffee, chocolate and dark caramel. Mouthfeel smooth, rich, full. Flavor of deep rich roastiness and dark caramel. Just intense, intense roasty flavor over rich caramel, coffee and chocolate. Amazing rich smooth taste. Nice bitter, hoppy bite in finish. Best stout Ive had that didnt have the word "imperial" in front of it.
Bomber, pours opaque black with creamy off-white head, aroma is rich blend of cocoa, hazelnut, cream, and some kahlua, incredibly rich and creamy with some light sweetness on finish, very tasty

Bottle.  Aroma: Coffee and chocolate, lactose, caramel and malty sweetness.  Pours black, thick tan head with very good retention, lots of lacing.  Mellow roasty flavor, pleasant sweetness, rich chocolate, nice coffee notes, slight bitterness.  Creamy mouthfeel, full body with medium carbonation, very smooth.  Another great 3F brew.

dark nearly black, with tan head, limited retention, some light lacing... roast, cream, some light fruits, some light chocolate... medium body, a little watery almost, nice lightly dry finish, some slickness... nice creamy roasty lightly chocolatey lightly coffee stout. some light fruits...

Bottle via trade with drfabulous, thanks! Poured at a local stout tasting with friends.  Pours a deep black with slight tan head.  Aroma is sweet and coffee forward with a tiny amount of vanilla.  Not a lot of chocolate present in the nose.  Taste has some cream to it with slight milk chocolate and some elements of dark chocolate and roasted malt. Mouth feel was lacking to me and felt too light for the taste.  Overall, it didnt stand out but wasnt in the bottom for the day either.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Got a 22 oz bottle in a trade with a non-ratebeerian. Pours nearly black with thin tan head with good retention. Nose of roasted malt and lactose.  Taste has a upfront sweetness with a coffee bitterness as it warms. Mouthfeel is medium to a near fullness. Smooth, creamy finish. This is a great example of the style and is well worth a try. Nice job from this brewery.

Bomber poured into a snifter is almost pitch black, with brown edges and light tan head.  Aromas are roasted malts, and sweetness.  Tastes are roasted malt, lactose, and a nice light hop and coffee finish.  Very good milk stout....yum.

(22oz bottle courtesy of Nuplastikk).  Pours near pitch balack with a creamy espresso head and tiny carbonation bubbles.  Aroma has coffee, chocolate, dark pit fruit.  Taste is sweet and roasty malt backbone.  Full bodied with a creamy texture.  Smooth finish.  Quite a delicious beer.

Bottle pours dark brown/black with a beige head and nice lacing. Aroma shows lactose, cocoa, and light roasted malt. Flavor shows more milk chocolate than dark, as well as some light coffee and caramel notes. Overall body is moderate to full, relatively sweet, and has a nice creamy finish almost like a milkshake.

Top notch milk stout.  This is the best Ive had of the style.  Pours a creamy black with minimal tan head.  Aroma is decent but nothing special with sweet chocolate and light roasty notes.  Taste is medium sweet with chocolate, coffee, caramel and toast.  Creamy and silky smooth and really easy to drink for such a viscous beer.  A pleasure.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2012 Perfectly executed milk stout. Creamy and very drinkable. Lightly chocolately and coffee flavors. Clean smooth milky finish. Awesome brew

Pours a very dark brown, nearly black, with a nice tan head.  Aroma of chocolate and coffee.  Tastes primarily of coffee, with nice chocolate undertones.  Finishes smooth and long, pretty creamy with a some bitterness .  Overall pretty good brew, the easiest sipping stout Ive come across so far.

22oz from our sneaky friends at Chucks: pours espresso black with creamy tan head. a fair bit of lacing. Baking chocolate, roasted coffee beans and malts, vanilla and hazelnut on the nose. T- milk chocolate, vanilla, sweet biscuit malts, lactose. Velvet mouthfeel with brief bitterness on the back of your throat. Quite nice and drinkable.

Smells like coffee and vanilla, but kind of musty.  
Color is a deep black with a tiny ring of white foam.
Heavy taste of vanilla, sweet up front but a coffee bitter finish.
Slick and oily with a coffee finish.
This is a great beer, sweet but still burnt, no alcohol burn at all.
Really dark with a big espresso head.  Smell is roast coffee and sugars.  Really creamy and full bodied.  Coffee and chocolate in taste with a classic 3 Floyds bitterness.

I was expecting more from this one, but it is a decent Milk Stout. Full body, lots of chocolatey malt and coffee notes. Semi-sweet finish, not cloyingly so. Good thick mouth feel and finishes nice. To be fair, I prefer dry stouts, but this is from the mighty 3Fs and besides, Im a fan of the book/film A Clockwork Orange so I couldnt pass it up when I saw it on the shelf.

Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted malts, oats and raisins/cherries. Appearance is pitch black with tan head. Flavor matches the nose, but with a surprising herbal hop presence; the finish is slightly smokey. Palate is very bubbly. Great stuff.
Poured a dark black/brown, with aromas of coffee, lactose, chocolate, and molasses.  Creamy on the palate with the flavors matching aroma, with a slight bitnerness aftertaste.

Pours a dark brown, almost black, with a thick, soapy, tan head.  Aromas of roasted coffee, chocolate, and caramels. Taste is sweet and bitter.  Not a hoppy bitter but a coffee bitter.  Palate is creamy with little carbonation.  Short finish.  Overall, this is a great beer.  Extremely creamy and not overly dry.  Love how it starts out a little sweet with the caramels and brown sugars or molasses, but then the coffee bitterness jumps into leave  nice overall flavor.  Does FFF brew anything that is not great?
Bomber. Pours black with a quarter inch tan head with good retention. Aroma is roasted coffee and chocolate. Flavor is the same plus some milk sweetness. Delicious.
Bomber. Black with tan head that disappears quickly to nothing. Anise, bit of chocolate, smooth, some lactose, sweet but light on the finish, partly dry. Ok.

On tap at the brewery.  Pours black with a thick tan head.  Aroma of oats, smooth roasted malt, and a hint of lactose.  Flavor of sweet sweet malt, roast, and lactose.  Smooth palate.  Decent stout, not terribly interesting though, definitely a little sweet.
7/4/6/4/14 [3.5/5]

Brand new bottle right from the brewery, they dont even advertise that they have this yet hahaha!! Pours dark brown to black with a luxurious dark brown 1 finger head.  Aroma is very sweet with notes of oatmeal, milk chocolate, a hint of lightly roasted coffee, and dark dried fruit. Taste is sweet chocolate milk with earthy roast and sweet oatmeal.  Body is medium, which is light for the style and for the amount of alcohol--- I think the reason for this is that this is a "Baltic" stout which means it was brewed with lager yeast...interesting.  Soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, and a lush sweet finish.  As far as Floyds beer goes, I feel like this vintage (2011) is more poorly executed than in previous years.  Also, they upped the price from $8 per 22oz to $10, which prompted me to call bullshit these fools!

Shared bottle at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Black with a creamy brown head. Baileys, sweet, roasted, milky aroma with vanilla, raisins, prunes and other dark dried fruits on the nose. Sweet and fruity flavors. Honey, maple syrup, dark caramel sauce, roasted malts and prune juice. Medium to full body. Feels thin. Gentle carbonation.

Shared bottle at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours black with a tiny tanned head. Aroma of soft caramel,liquorice, fruity hops. Taste is mellow, light burnt/roasted malts . Nice beer to end an evening in beerheaven.
Brown black pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is sweet chocolate and light coffee. Flavor is deep rich chocolate with a hint of coffee. Full rich bodied with smooth carbonation. Very nice beer.

Pour black no head what so ever. Aroma metallic, roasty, coffee, cocoa. Taste chocolate, roast malt, coffee, vanilla, caramel, metallic. MF full creamy body mild carb. Overall meh the metallic taste was off putting.

First stout for me from Three Floyds and this was very enjoyable.  Pours black with a dark, tan head.  Aroma is sweet, malty and chocolate.  Taste is robust, full flavored chocolate, malt and a bit of a bourbon finish.  Full bodied on the palate.  Great brew and definitely worth a try.

Bottle courtesy of atom.  Pour is dark brown with a small tan head.  Sweet aroma with a hint of roasted malt.  Reminds me of a tootsie roll.  Flavor is sweet with chocolate, some roast coffee, and a little bit of lactose.  Second time around having this, and it is still as good as I remember.

Bomber picked from brewery last summer pours dark brown/black with amber highlights and thin tan head. Aroma of malty milk chocolate, dark fruits, and some booze. Taste has an upfront sweetness in to creamy milk chocolate flavors, vanilla, with a fresh ground coffee finish. Really nice!

dark black body with a tan head that rises about a finger but dissolves almost instantly... sweet nose, almost smells barrel aged, sweet cream on the front with bitter chocolate, sweet liquor, smells good... tastey but way way way to thin, so thin at first thats all I get and Im instantly distracted, taste is light sweet cream, sweet alcohol, crushable but boring

Bottle courtesy of adrian910ss, or rather 2 oz were courtesy of adrian910ss. Pours a black espresso colour with a slight beige colored head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, lactose, and alcohol. Flavour of lactose, milk sugar, bitter chocolate, and malt.

Bottle 22 oz. Split this with Vinny before an Eagles game awhile back, and last night with James. Pours a motor-oil silky smooth black with a thin bit of wispy tan lace upon the surface and lining the rim of the snifter. Nose is huge on vanilla, fresh cream, milk chocolate, freshly ground coffee beans, and very subtle spicy red pepper and cinnamon notes. Huge chocolate and cream flavors swirl up front and slide down easily with a velvety, rich, chocolatey oatmeal smooth finish. Tremendously gratifying, rich, fulfilling milk stout. Excellent.
Bottle split with Pat and PJ. Pours a deep black body with thin brown lacing. Aroma is creamy and milky. Mouthfeel is creamy with notes of sweet chocolate, sweet malts. and cream.

The nose on this includes chocolate, coffee, cereal, roasted grain, and a little raisin.  It settles into my snifter deep brown in color with an fine finger of tan head that dissipates within minutes.  Not a lot of lacing, but it does take its time down the glass after a sip.  It is sweet with a pleasant bitter finish.  The body is medium with a creamy texture, and the carbonation is soft.  This is a very enjoyable beer to drink.  The raisins fade to creamy chocolate bliss as it warms.  Better than Founders Breakfast Stout, but its close.

22oz bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  Pours a jet black with a thin tan head.  Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate.  Thick body on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate.  Very tasty.

Very tasty milk stout. Pours a nice thick, dark brown with small, creamy, tan head. Aroma of roasted nuts. Flavor has some nuttiness, some chocolate, some licorice, with a sweetness and full-bodied mouthfeel to it. Yum!

I bought this at a bottle shop in munster, Indiana after drinking a great amount of be at three floyds brewpub. I was worried it might be a bit soured cause its a few months old and in dont know too much about milk stouts other than it has lactose added to it (message me if Im wrong). It was great. It poured dark with hardly no head. It was sweet and  creamy. It had a slight tang to it. It was sweet but balanced by the roasted malts and underlying bitterness. I loved it. Great body and mouth feel. Definitely looking forward to trying more milk stouts.

22 oz. bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany), pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, lactate and molasses. Flavour is very milky, sweet chocolate and light roastiness. Very smooth, silky, creamy texture. Delicious.

Bottle.  Pours very dark with a light tan head.  Aroma and flavor are sweet roasted malt, some nuts, and milk chocolate.  I didnt pick up licorice at all, which I would expect from something calling itself a Baltic stout.  Palate is creamy but not particularly lactic.  Alcohol is very muted.  Had this late in a big beer tasting, so Im sure I missed some of the subtleties.  (By the way, "moloko" is Russian for milk.)
Pours dark black with tan head, aroma has notes of chocolate, vanilla, dark sugar, sweet caramel.  Taste is sweet lactose, chocolate and vanilla, some caramel and toffee notes.  Good stuff.
Poured from a 22.  Dark with a nice head.  Nose mostly of chocolate and malt.  Taste was chocolate, coffee, vanilla and malty goodness.  Alcohol is well hidden.  This is a tasty FFF offering.

Pours a velvety, deep, dark brown that is translucent around the edges with almost no head.  Nose is hops, bourbon, and a bit of vanilla.  Very sweet flavor with a great mesh of hops and malt, notes of vanilla come through.  A very, very easy drinking milk stout.  Probably the best Ive ever had of the style.
Poured from a 22oz bottle.  Pours black with a nice thick head.  Aroma is chocolate and roasted malts.  Taste was sweet molasses, some chocolate.  Very smooth, oatmeal stout.

650 ml bottle, only 6.49 from Discount Liquor in Milwaukee, in a state that FFF doesnt distribute to, yet I can only find it for 9.99 in Illinois. Quirkly label art adorns the bottle.

Pours a dark black/brown with a small caramel colored head. Leaves come nice lacing.

Smell is really sweet, almost like a chocolate stout but with less cocoa flavor. Also has the roasted malt scent. Maybe even some vanilla in there.

Taste is mega sweet and delicious. More so than the other milkstouts I have had, it isnt as creamy as some but it really feels and tastes like a decadent dessert. Very chocolatey, sugary, and carmally, decadence. No too sweet, not too heavy either, a really well produced beer.

This is about as drinkable as it gets for a stout and it is a great beer to cap the night off with.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-19-2009 04:07:31
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 Nice stuff. Not as sweet as some other milk stouts. Toffee flavors and every once and awhile anise but very slight. Serving: Bottle

Opaque beer with a short lived foamy brown head that left an oily sheen on the surface of the beer.   Thick sweet molasses nose with some tar, ash and chocolate.  Sweet beer with lots of dark brown sugar and molasses, buttered burnt toast, dark chocolate, lactic acidity and faint campfire.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Very nice sweet stout.

While this is a good sweet stout, it didnt live up to expectations.  I thought all the ingredients were there but just a like light in each category.  This was especially prominent in color and palate.
Bottle.  Pour is deep sark brown with light tan head,  Aroma is light roasted malt, light lacto component, and light caramel.  Flavor is similar.  Lighter body than expected.
This stout has a nice roast, cocoa, coffee, creaminess, and very slight sweet after taste. I would prefer if this beer had a slightly bigger body.
Who says you cant have chocolate chip cookies with beer. Only someone who hasnt tried Moloko. This is like a chocolate dessert. Yes I had cookies with it. Yummmmmm!

750ml bottle. Appearance is very dark. Pitch black with no head. Aroma of chocolate and  malts. Flavor is pretty sweet with hints of dark chocolate, coffee. Carries with it  a milky lactose texture. Very easy to  drink and very very good.

Bottle @ OznNZ tasting 2011.
Completely black with a small, creamy, beige head. Aroma has light milk, chocolate, a bit of liqourice, mild cold coffee. Lowish carbonation, soft and velvety creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet (indeed very sweet), roasted malts, milky chocolate. Light dry. Very lovely, but sure could use some bitterness to balance the sweetness.

Bomber- appearance dark cola, thin chocolate milk head.   Nose- black licorice, vanilla, stale coffee, bakers chocolate. Taste-  very sweet- milk chocolate, brownies, light roast.  More one dimensional then the nose let on. Body is not that heavy and has robust carbonation.  Not picking up much booze heat, fairly easy drinking although the flavour profile does get tiring.

Bomber from thetomG. Thanks! Pours pitch black with a fizzy medium sized brown head. Poor head retention and OK lacing. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, lightly roasted malts and a sweet note. The taste is roasted malts, a lactic note, some caramel and some toastiness. Almost a coconut-like note. Medium bodied. Nicely done. Good beer.

Bottle. Not-impenetrable black, with brown highlights. Small, fizzy brown head. Nose is STRONG coffee, slight vanilla and chocolate. "Smells" sweet. More coffee and chocolate on the tongue, with the requisite smooth sweetness expected of a milk stout. Soft mouthfeel, slightly watery. Lively carbonation. Cant taste a bit of the booze. Not my favorite 3F brew, but very solid.

Another well made beer from these guys. Have not had one of their treats in a while and oh to have them on a more regular basis would be awesome. My dark beer craving is satisfied for now. A slightly roasty aroma with a smoothed out air to it. Flavor is much more roasted malt and chocolate with a milky creamy texture to the whole experience. Very nice here.

Bottle.  Chocolate, coffee and light ash aroma.  Opaque black-brown color with small head - pours like oil.  Sweet dark chocolate malt and bitter coffee flavor.  Light astringent/ashy aftertaste.  Excellent.

Pours very thick and dark, almost looks like black milk.  Heavy appearance with a small dense head.  Aroma is sweet, with a milk chocolatey likeness.  Initial taste of sweet malt and milk with a chocolate finish.  After a few sips it opens up a different flavor profile, as the chocolate flavor gets richer.

Pours a deep black, noticeably viscous, with a very small head. The aroma is roasty with some booze and a light vinous character. It certainly smells sweet but not overly sugary. The flavor is nice with plenty of that milky sweetness and a bit of booziness. The coffee roastiness really rounds this one out  along with a good bit of cherry, vanilla, & dark chocolate.
High creamy and long lasting brown head. Pitch black body. Powerful choccolate coffee nuts aroma. Choccolate coffee cream flavor with a sour note. Low carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste.

A: Pours black and opaque with a relatively-small brown head.

S: Roasted malt with a little bit of chocolate, combined with a hefty dose of the lactose.

T: Sweet, roasted malt with the milk sugars coming through in the sweetness. A little bit of chocolate comes through as well.

M: Fairly light-bodied, although Ive never really enjoyed milk stouts that were too viscous.

D: Pretty good, would be nice in cooler weather, but my first sample came in the Spring.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-25-2009

22oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, a hint of coffee.  Flavor the same with a lot of sweetness of a milk stout.  A very balanced beer with a rich texture.  Great stout.

Black with a disappearing off-white head. Weak aroma of malt, chocolate and licorice. Sweet malty flavour with chocolate and a roasted note. Somewhat disappointing considering the strength and the brewery.
Tap @ MikkellerBar. Black with small beige head. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, licorice , little chocolate and hops.
At Mikkeller bar.Black colour with small beige head.Aroma of coffee and licorice rosted and tosted with smooth and light sour mouthfeels and hint of tobacco aswell.

De barril/chopp. Totally black colour, small nice creamy light brown head. Aroma: pleasant roasted maltiness, sweet, chocolate, mildly tart. Good mouthfeel. Flavour: Roasted malt, dark fruit, chocolate, bit coffee, bit tart.

tap @ mikkeller bar black sensation event.
pitch dark, small smooth light brown head.
faint aroma, faint licorice. surprisingly faint aroma. I even tried to warm it up, but to no avail.
flavor is hoppy, roastedr grainish, wild yeasty, faint licorice, also ends hoppy.

13-NOV-2010, tap @Mikkeller, "Black Sensation" event.
Black with brown head.
Sweet with chocolate, and a fruity slightly tart note - cherries?
Some hops there as well, but mostly just roasted and smooth.
Roasted but in a fine way, no way burned.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pitch black pour with a creamy tan head. The aroma is roasted malt, light lacto acidic, sweet caramel and chocolate. The flavour is light coffee, sweet malt, light tobacco and light lacto. Some roasted coffee notes in the finish.

Murky black with orange-tan head.  Aroma of coffee with cream.  Chocolate, coffee, toffee, mild fruit and a touch of sweetness.  Great medium to full mouthfeel  with the lactose.  Bitter malt finish with some hops.

Draught at MikkellerBAR. 
Black - brown head. 
Burned. Fruity. Light peppery. Light hoppy. Licorice. Light milkey. Berries. High malty. Nice.
Nose of weak cereal, sweet malts, feel is elegant/wine-like, carb is medium, taste is rotten fruit, weak port, plum, late broad malt

bomber.  Someone shared this at the Freetail La Muerta release.  Pours black with light brown bubbles in lieu of head.  Nose is of milk chocolate and roast malt.  Taste is the same milk chocolate.  Mouthfeel is medium-thin, oily and sweet.  Pretty good.

22 oz. bottle from Three Floyds in Munster, IN.  Pours dark brown with a creamy beige head.  Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted espresso, and hints of smoke.  The flavor is sweet vanilla upfront with an initial presence of alcohol but is followed by dark chocolate and hints of smoke on the finish.
